intro: Crantzia schlimii, commonly known as Schlim's crantzia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, and it has narrow, grass-like leaves. Crantzia schlimii is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand high salt levels and strong winds.
